title: uneng
author: uneng
content: The internet was taken by surprise after the news the shiba inu, Cheems Balltze (12 years old), which inspired dogecoin cryptocurrency logo passed away after a battle against cancer. Not only inside the crypto community, the dog was pretty popular on several niches of the internet since the last decade and was probably known by people who didn't even have notice about Bitcoin or Dogecoin.Quote“He fell asleep on Friday morning during his last thoracentesis surgery. Originally, we wanted to arrange chemotherapy or other possible treatment for him after this operation, but it is too late now,” his owner said on Instagram.However, she asked fans not to be “sad” but to “remember the joy that Balltze brought to the world”.Shiba Inu made famous by viral ‘doge’ meme dies after cancer battle

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: Amazing! To think I didn't know about the Doge/Shiba Inu meme concept was heavily inspired by Cheems Balltze. I didn't know there was a story to it and it feels satisfying to know that it's not just a random concept. I wish Cheems Balltze well and its owner as well. She can find solace in the fact that her dog inspired a lot of crazy trends and put smiles on the first of people.Cheems Balltze might be good but the doge/shiba inu memes and trends inspired by those memes will continue to live on.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: I searched the internet and found this article, it has a lot of information for meme lovers and how the story started with Balltze aka Cheems as well as details of the early years and how the dogecoin joke started.https://knowyourmeme.com/editorials/interviews/chatting-with-cheems-balltzes-owner-gives-us-some-personal-insight-into-life-with-one-of-the-webs-favorite-shibasI can't believe this whole joke started with an Instagram story.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Really touching story!!! Thank you for sharing the news. I did not know these details about a real Shiba Inu dog.It's unfortunate that Cheems Balltze is gone, but it left a lasting impression on the crypto community that they will never forget.It is certain that its owner will be very saddened by the separation of her beloved dog.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: I really thought that dog was already dead; I mean it was just social media and Doge Coin that kind of made it alive because of the meme, but again, that dog is really famous, and I was amazed with its story and journey in its meme and also in the Doge Coin story. Cheems will always be here in our hearts as the memes continue to live, as well as the Doge Coin.

comments.author: Maestro75
comments.body: This is farewell to a dog that gave us content and became famous more than alot of humans. The dog story is an interesting one. How something can be made out of nothing. Am not sad that it died. But the way it died that makes me sad. Maybe one day all this news about cancer will end and the world will be free of that demonic disease. Goodnight Shiba, goodnight Cheems.

comments.author: sesterceshop
comments.body: Cheems was a true memelord. He will be remembered for his many expressions and his ability to make us laugh.  RIP.

comments.author: Godday
comments.body: I wish him all the best. Even though it is a meme coin, I was very inspired by the story of Balltze aka Cheems. This is a very inspiring story. Keep smiling in the face of all problems as he said so don't be sad about his death.

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: The story is very touching; it's just sad that it happened like that. I'm sure that you will not be forgotten by all the communities here in the crypto space. The good story you told here will remain. I just felt sad because we can't do anything because all the animals are really passing by.Honestly, I just found out that this Doge logo of a Shiba Inu has such a story. Stay strong and be happy.

comments.author: SlamDunkIT
comments.body: Happy Puppy! In a world too full of sadness and bad news, he helped bring joy and fun to millions of people. He leaves a legacy which will go on for a long time. Great story, thank you.

comments.author: isaac_clarke22
comments.body: As much I don't really like meme coins like Shiba Inu due to the way it was hyped, it's quite different for me whenever the symbol gets mentioned in me. It's quite heart warming whenever I imagine a dog being symbol of something.I heard this news recently also in social media, and I didn't expect for it to be somehow mentioned here in crypto due to how people see meme coins as just money printing machine in the short-term.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: UHH Turns out Cheems Balltze is even cuter looking at some of the photos shared on social media.I don't really look deeply into the concept of the Shiba Inu logo because it's not a coin I want to invest in but with his passing many people are looking for a lot of news about Cheems Balltze, maybe they will lose their favorite dog but the memory will always be in the shiba inu coin meme that the community continues to hold.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: uneng on August 29, 2023, 09:16:35 PMThe internet was taken by surprise after the news the shiba inu, Cheems Balltze (12 years old), which inspired dogecoin cryptocurrency logo passed away after a battle against cancer. Not only inside the crypto community, the dog was pretty popular on several niches of the internet since the last decade and was probably known by people who didn't even have notice about Bitcoin or Dogecoin.-cut-If i was the owner of that dog, i would definitely set up a wallet for donations in order to build a shrine for that doge. I mean it shouldn't be impossible donations from both shiba inu and doge communities. t would be good press and uniting the community to stand for good things and cute doggos.But maybe they want to mourn in peace and don't want that cute dog to represent cryptos. I would totally understand that too.

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: Quote from: sesterceshop on August 30, 2023, 06:57:21 AMCheems was a true memelord. He will be remembered for his many expressions and his ability to make us laugh.  RIP.Such as life everyone will go according to their given time. But honestly, I thought the Shiba Inu token faced some trouble just like the other dead tokens in the past but as I read the OP means the literal dog who is the owner of the logo. Anyway, if I were the owner of Doge and Shiba Inu, I would use this opportunity positively to promote my products because of this trend and it cannot be missed since they are given free promotions from the Dog and maybe this is his last mission.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Another hachiko story that has made significant heartfelt for most of its lovers, mostly for meme coin and dogecoin lovers.Rest easy Cheems.I didn't know that you've got a surname as well. But anyway, you're part of a great community and has contributed significant history to the world of meme coins and cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: I share my condolences for the death of one of the world's meme figures. However, she is just a dog who wasn't realized how famous she is. But I think in her last years alive she may have benefited from that fame after the original owner sold her genesis meme image (NFT) at auction for $4 million.Anyway, R.I.P Kabosu (かぼす) Musk must attend her funeral.

comments.author: Jating
comments.body: Sad to hear this, although I must admit that I didn't know that there is a real life Doge logo in Cheems Balltze.I just the breed really created the first meme coins in doge coin and I will say that up to this day, it is still very relevant in crypto world and it has made it's imprint already that there are a lot of Dogecoin imitations out there.@jossiel - Hachiko story though is very different as it touch a lot of hearts and made us cry.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: From Dogecoin which has been a part of the crypto community for so long. Then, Shiba Inu (token) came which is the actual breed of Cheems.Quote from: Jating on August 31, 2023, 05:56:23 AMSad to hear this, although I must admit that I didn't know that there is a real life Doge logo in Cheems Balltze.This breed has got the same faces but we'll get to see the uniqueness when you own one. I don't also know that he's got a name and thought that it was just like a common picture on the web and just grabbed by the Doge developers. RIP to the most popular shiba inu.

comments.author: tsaroz
comments.body: With the power of meme, Cheems would always live with us. Though most of us are personally not known to Chimes as an individual dog. His image would keep on ignite the thrill to contemporary as well as to future generations. Famous for meme phrases, Cheems doge face was a perfect icon for a pioneering electronic meme coin. "Such silence, much empty, so meme-ories remain."

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: Quote from: noorman0 on August 31, 2023, 12:40:42 AMI share my condolences for the death of one of the world's meme figures. However, she is just a dog who wasn't realized how famous she is. But I think in her last years alive she may have benefited from that fame after the original owner sold her genesis meme image (NFT) at auction for $4 million.Anyway, R.I.P Kabosu (かぼす) Musk must attend her funeral.That's not Kabosu (Doge), that's Balltze (Cheems)... They're two different dogs, lol. Kabosu is still alive. OP was wrong, which is probably why I had them on ignore. Here's a good way to tell them apart (Doge is on the left and Cheems is on the right):Kabosu is actually a couple years older than Cheems. Only $DOGE is based on Kabosu, and $SHIB is based on $DOGE. There is no Cheems token AFAIK.
